courseDetails.longDescription:
Professional Agile Leadership (PAL I) certification is a program that aims to recognize the knowledge and skills of professionals who work in leadership roles in an Agile environment. The certification validates an individual's ability to lead Agile organizations, manage Agile projects, and promote Agile principles and values within their organization.

The PAL I certification exam focuses on key areas such as Agile leadership, culture and mindset, strategy and tactics, and Agile frameworks and methodologies. The exam assesses candidates' understanding of Agile principles, the Scrum framework, Kanban, Lean, and other Agile approaches, as well as their ability to apply Agile practices to different situations.

To be eligible for the PAL I certification, candidates must have a minimum of three years of Agile and/or leadership experience. They must also have completed the PAL I course which covers key Agile leadership concepts, principles, and practices.

The PAL I certification is ideal for Agile coaches, Scrum Masters, project managers, executives, and anyone in a leadership role who wants to improve their understanding of Agile and its application to their organization.


The learning objectives of the Professional Agile Leadership (PAL I) certification include:

  1. Understanding Agile leadership: This includes understanding the role of leadership in Agile organizations, the difference between traditional and Agile leadership, and the importance of creating an Agile culture.

  2. Developing an Agile mindset: This involves understanding the values and principles of Agile, and how they can be applied to leadership and management.

  3. Applying Agile frameworks and methodologies: This includes understanding the Scrum framework, Kanban, Lean, and other Agile approaches, and how they can be used to manage projects and teams.

  4. Creating an Agile strategy: This involves developing an Agile roadmap and vision, and aligning organizational goals with Agile practices.

  5. Managing Agile teams: This includes understanding how to create self-organizing teams, manage team dynamics, and foster collaboration and communication.

  6. Promoting Agile values and principles: This involves understanding how to communicate the benefits of Agile to stakeholders, and how to promote a culture of continuous improvement.

The Professional Agile Leadership (PAL I) certification exam is an online, timed exam that consists of 36 multiple-choice questions. Candidates have 60 minutes to complete the exam, and must score at least 85% (31 correct answers out of 36) to pass.

The PSM2 certification focuses on the role of the Scrum Master as a servant-leader and facilitator within an organization adopting Agile and Scrum methodologies. It delves deeper into the principles and values of Scrum, explores advanced Scrum techniques, and emphasizes the Scrum Master's ability to facilitate team collaboration, resolve conflicts, and drive continuous improvement.

To attain the PSM2 certification, candidates are required to pass an online assessment that assesses their understanding and application of Scrum principles and practices. The assessment consists of multiple-choice questions, case studies, and essay-style questions, which evaluate the candidate's ability to handle complex Scrum scenarios and make informed decisions.


Earning the PSM2 certification can enhance career opportunities for Scrum Masters, as it is recognized globally and highly regarded by organizations that value Agile and Scrum practices. The AWS Certified Developer - Associate (DVA-C02) exam is intended for individuals who perform a developer role. The exam validates a candidate’s ability to demonstrate proficiency in developing, testing, deploying, and debugging AWS cloud-based applications. The exam also validates a candidate’s ability to complete the following tasks:

• Develop and optimize applications on AWS

• Package and deploy by using continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) workflows

• Secure application code and data

• Identify and resolve application issues


With the AWS Certified Developer - Associate (DVA-C02) certification, you demonstrate you have the necessary skills to build, deploy, and maintain AWS applications. That can help you gain access to better job opportunities and advance your career, but even if you are perfectly happy where you are, the DVA-CO2, helps to ensure you are up-to-date on the evolving AWS platform.


My DVA-C02 AWS Certified Developer practice test is designed to help candidates prepare for and pass the AWS DVA-C02 exam.

This exam is aimed at developers with experience in AWS technology who want to validate their skills.

Candidates should have experience working in a developer role with in-depth knowledge of at least one high-level programming language, and strong on-premises IT experience and understanding of mapping on-premises to cloud.

They should be able to work in other cloud services as well.


Over 130 minutes, you will complete 65 questions that provide multiple-response or multiple-choice answers. The exam can be taken online in an online proctored context or at an accredited Pearson VUE testing center.

The AWS Associate Developer Certification is typically offered in several languages to accommodate a wide variety of test takers. You can take the DVA-C02 in English, French (from France), Japanese, Italian, Portuguese (from Brazil), Simplified Chinese, German, Korean, and Spanish (from Latin America).

Test takers are not required to have any specific training before taking the exam, but it never hurts to prepare to ensure the best possible outcome.


This test contains  03 FULL Mock Tests (65 questions each) and 03 HARDER Test (130 questions each) to stress test you before taking the real exam; covers the following objectives:

* Deployment with AWS services - 37

* Security - 37

* Development - 49

* Troubleshooting and Optimization - 28
